channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The Trump administration is reducing the number of federal agents in Minnesota by 700
item.description: The Trump administration is reducing the number of immigration officers in Minnesota by 700, but there's still no end date for the surge despite weeks of turmoil and the deaths of two U.S. citizens.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration is reducing the number of immigration officers in Minnesota by 700, but there's still no end date for the surge despite weeks of turmoil and the deaths of two U.S. citizens.
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson

item.title: Minnesota AG Keith Ellison on withdrawal of federal immigration agents
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel asks Minnesota Attorney General Keith Ellison what concessions leaders in his state are willing to make to secure a further withdrawal of federal immigration agents.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel asks Minnesota Attorney General Keith Ellison what concessions leaders in his state are willing to make to secure a further withdrawal of federal immigration agents.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: More than 160 people killed by suspected Islamist militants in Nigeria
item.description: As Nigeria battles multiple security crises, a single attack in the west left more than 160 people dead and raises new questions about who's really in control.
item.content:encoded: As Nigeria battles multiple security crises, a single attack in the west left more than 160 people dead and raises new questions about who's really in control.
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Akinwotu

item.title: Poll: Two-thirds of Americans say ICE has 'gone too far' in immigration enforcement
item.description: A new NPR/PBS News/Marist poll finds a jump in disapproval of the agency among Democrats and independents, but Republicans are standing by ICE and the president.
item.content:encoded:
A new NPR/PBS News/Marist poll finds a jump in disapproval of the agency among Democrats and independents, but Republicans are standing by ICE and the president.

(Image credit: John Moore)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Hundreds of federal agents are leaving from Minnesota, poll finds a jump in disapproval of ICE among Democrats and Independents, the last major arms control treaty between Russia and the U.S. expires.
item.content:encoded: Hundreds of federal agents are leaving from Minnesota, poll finds a jump in disapproval of ICE among Democrats and Independents, the last major arms control treaty between Russia and the U.S. expires.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: 'It Was Just An Accident' director talks about film and the arrest of his co-writer
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Iranian director Jafar Panahi after one of the co-writers of his Oscar-nominated film, "It Was Just An Accident," was arrested for criticizing the regime.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Iranian director Jafar Panahi after one of the co-writers of his Oscar-nominated film, "It Was Just An Accident," was arrested for criticizing the regime.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: U.S. enters Winter Olympics as its image on the world stage is changing
item.description: The Olympics are a symbol of international cooperation and peace. The U.S. was once seen as a bastion of that order, but historians say it enters this year's Winter Games with a very different image.
item.content:encoded: The Olympics are a symbol of international cooperation and peace. The U.S. was once seen as a bastion of that order, but historians say it enters this year's Winter Games with a very different image.
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Venezuela's interim leader works to balance U.S. demands and Chavista expectations
item.description: A month after Maduro's ousting, Venezuela's Interim leader walks a tightrope between US demands and Chavista hardliners' expectations.
item.content:encoded: A month after Maduro's ousting, Venezuela's Interim leader walks a tightrope between US demands and Chavista hardliners' expectations.
item.dc:creator: Manuel Rueda

item.title: New Jersey voters head to the polls for special congressional primary
item.description: New Jersey voters head to the polls for one of the year's first congressional primaries. WNYC's Mike Hayes discusses the special election for the House seat left open by now-Gov. Mikie Sherrill.
item.content:encoded: New Jersey voters head to the polls for one of the year's first congressional primaries. WNYC's Mike Hayes discusses the special election for the House seat left open by now-Gov. Mikie Sherrill.
item.dc:creator: Mike Hayes

item.title: After historic flooding, Washington residents rebuild and reckon with the future
item.description: In Washington state, over 400 homes were destroyed or sustained major damage from historic flooding in December. We hear about what recovery looks like and how people are thinking about future flood risk.
item.content:encoded: In Washington state, over 400 homes were destroyed or sustained major damage from historic flooding in December. We hear about what recovery looks like and how people are thinking about future flood risk.
item.dc:creator: Casey Martin
